intro: Peplonia nitida, commonly known as the white peplonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Peplonia nitida is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment.
